decks.notes: The deck focuses on using cycling cards to quickly build a board presence and generate card advantage, while also efficiently dealing damage to the opponent. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion that allows for recurring key creatures. The deck utilizes cards like Zenith Flare and Drannith Stinger to deal damage directly to the opponent, while also using Improbable Alliance to generate consistent threats. With a combination of cycling abilities and powerful creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and utilizing Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Koma, Cosmos Serpent early in the game. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells and card draw sources to maintain board presence and outvalue the opponent. By ramping up with Llanowar Visionary and utilizing versatile creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and finish off the game quickly with big threats like Lovestruck Beast and Koma, Cosmos Serpent.

The Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes powerful finishers like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany to close out the game. The deck aims to outvalue opponents with its versatile threats like Elder Gargaroth and Polukranos, while also utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional card advantage. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's three-color identity and ensure consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on leveraging powerful creatures with abilities that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out big threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and Lovestruck Beast, the deck aims to assert board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game. The deck also has a mix of removal and counterspells to control the game and protect its creatures. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colored spells, allowing for versatility in casting spells and ensuring consistent performance.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of efficient removal spells and mill effects. By utilizing cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Ruin Crab to mill the opponent's deck, and Soaring Thought-Thief to boost the strategy, the deck aims to empty the opponent's library while controlling the board with cards like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act. With the help of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck can maintain its control over the game and secure victory through resource management and manipulation.

The main focus of this deck is to consistently put pressure on the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing creatures with strong abilities and efficient mana costs. The deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and buff its creatures with combat tricks and enchantments like Showdown of the Skalds. It also utilizes the companion card Jegantha, the Wellspring to provide additional ramp and versatility. By utilizing a mix of creature threats, removal spells, and card advantage engines, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using a variety of control spells and removals to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up mana to play powerful threats. The goal is to outvalue the opponent with cards like Emergent Ultimatum, Yorion, Sky Nomad, and powerful creatures like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The deck aims to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a combination of threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. It utilizes cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge to generate card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast serves as a key card for cheating out big threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The deck also includes various counterspells to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the strategy is to apply constant pressure and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main objective of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of disruptive spells and creatures that mill the opponent's deck. By utilizing cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Ruin Crab, and Drown in the Loch, the deck aims to limit the opponent's resources and win conditions. The inclusion of cards like Soaring Thought-Thief and Into the Story helps to maximize the milling potential of the deck, while also providing card advantage. With a focus on disrupting the opponent's strategy and milling their deck, this deck aims to maintain control of the game until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various means such as countering spells, removal, and milling the opponent's deck. By utilizing cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Ruin Crab, and Soaring Thought-Thief, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy and win condition. The deck aims to maintain board control and card advantage through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card draw. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck can also utilize its graveyard as a resource for additional value.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while gradually milling their library with cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Ruin Crab. By controlling the board and graveyard with cards like Drown in the Loch and Cling to Dust, the deck aims to maintain a strong advantage until it can overwhelm the opponent with card advantage from Into the Story and aggressive creatures. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides extra value by allowing the player to repeatedly recast low-cost creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and utilizing powerful equipment and enchantments to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. By constantly applying pressure with creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Magda, Brazen Outlaw, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of Embercleave and Esika's Chariot provides additional ways to boost the power of the creatures and push for lethal damage. The mana base allows for consistent casting of cards while ensuring a steady stream of threats to keep the opponent on the back foot.

This deck focuses on using efficient removal spells and disruptive creatures to maintain control of the board while steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for the recursion of cheap creatures and spells, giving the deck additional staying power in longer games. By consistently applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Kroxa and Elderfang Disciple and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Acquisitions Expert and Inscription of Ruin, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to build a strong board presence early on with aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Wildborn Preserver, supported by card advantage and tempo plays from Edgewall Innkeeper and Brazen Borrower. The deck also includes removal options like Bonecrusher Giant and Burning Hands to clear the way for attacks. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast serves as a powerful engine to cheat out big threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent. The mana base is designed to support a smooth curve and ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells.

The deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay using a combination of creatures and spells from the Temur color combination. It aims to control the board early on with efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, while utilizing cards like Edgewall Innkeeper for card advantage. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to quickly close out games. The deck's mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to the colors needed for its spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Magda, Brazen Outlaw and Minsc, Beloved Ranger to trigger Winota, Joiner of Forces' ability, allowing you to put high-impact creatures like Blade Historian and Kenrith, the Returned King onto the battlefield for free. The deck also utilizes cards like Lotus Cobra and Jaspera Sentinel to ramp up your mana production and maintain board presence. By overwhelming your opponent with a fast-paced aggro strategy, you can quickly close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.
